intro: Waldemaria argentea, commonly known as the silver waldemaria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are typically silver-gray in color, which helps it reflect sunlight and reduce water loss in its native habitat. Waldemaria argentea is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
